page.title: 09TEENAGE ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Some organisations for teenagers in Clydebank are:- The {UB40 Centre}is Clydebanks Unemployed Workers Centre.This is a project sponsored by the Clydebank Trades Council and Clydebank District Council and was opened in 1982. The Centre is open Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm.No membership is needed.The average age is 25 years, and there are more boys than girls in the Centre. The members watch videos and do art and design.The{Clydebank {Musical Society}was started in February 1981.There are 50 members and they stage shows every year.The{Hub CE {Centre}started in 1962.The age group of the members varies from 3 years to 90 years.During a week 28 clubs are held.There are approximately 150 members.{Braidfield High School Club } started in 1979.It is a running club and the 40 members are mostly boys.
